alert.note: Alert for Marion (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 12:45PM CDT until further notice by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Illinois... Mississippi River at Quincy. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Missouri...Illinois... Mississippi River at Hannibal. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Quincy. * WHEN...From Thursday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, The Clat Adams Bicentennial Park, just north of the Memorial Bridge, begins flooding. Also at this height, most roads in Kesler Park are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to 22.0 feet Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Mississippi River Quincy 19.0 17.7 18.4 19.3 20.1 20.8 21.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
